law.catch_line: To aid in the exercise of its rulemaking powers, the Court of Appeals may appoint a standing committ...
law.text: To aid in the exercise of its rulemaking powers, the Court of Appeals may appoint a standing committee of lawyers, judges, and other persons competent in judicial practice, procedure or administration. A committee member shall serve without compensation, but shall be reimbursed for traveling and other expenses incurred on committee business.
